# CKModifyRecordsOperation.RecordSavePolicy.allKeys

**Case**

A policy that instructs CloudKit to save all keys of a record, even those without changes.

## Declaration

```swift
case allKeys
```

## Discussion



This policy causes CloudKit to overwrite any existing values on the server. It’s possible for a server record to contain keys that aren’t present locally. Another client might add keys to the record after you fetch it. Also, if you use the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKFetchRecordsOperation/desiredKeys-34l1l] property to request a subset of keys during a fetch operation, saving that same record modifies only those keys that you include in the fetch and any keys you add to the record after that.

## Save Policies

- **CKModifyRecordsOperation.RecordSavePolicy.ifServerRecordUnchanged**: A policy that instructs CloudKit to only proceed if the record’s change tag matches that of the server’s copy.
- **CKModifyRecordsOperation.RecordSavePolicy.changedKeys**: A policy that instructs CloudKit to save only the fields of a record that contain changes.
